intro: Euhaynaldia exaltata, commonly known as the tall water starwort, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in North America. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its leaves are linear and arranged alternately along the stem, contributing to its aquatic appearance. Euhaynaldia exaltata plays a role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
